Description: Blue glazed composition shabti of Pediamennebnesutawy with a lappet-wig, a crudely modelled wig with a long thin beard, joined parallel hands in relief, the legs are inscribed with part of Chapter 6 of The Book of The Dead in six rows of black painted Hieroglyphs, the back-pillar is also inscribed with similar Hieroglyphs, the feet have broken away.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
